alert.note: Alert for Beaverhead and Western Madison below 6000ft; Madison River Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 12 at 3:24AM MST until January 14 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST SUNDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and areas of blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. * WHERE...The Madison and Beaverhead River Valleys. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 5 PM MST Sunday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 11 AM MST this morning. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility in the Madison and Jefferson River valleys as well as over Norris Hill. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.

area.areaDesc: Beaverhead and Western Madison below 6000ft; Madison River Valley
